record.description: Upon completion of the grinding and polishing process, Warner and Swasey officials oversee placement of the 3-ton 82-inch glass disc in the aluminizing chamber where systematic atomic bombardment will coat it with chromium and aluminum. From left: Warner Seely, company secretary; vice-president Charles J. Stilwell; George A. Decker, works engineer; Dr. John S. Plaskett, telescope design consultant; H. L. Cook, instrument department director; C. A. Robert Lundin, optical department director; and an unidentified worker.
